Description: Prevention and early detection strategies for cancer are urgently needed; however, the causes of many cancers remain poorly defined, and there is a lack of validated biomarkers of cancer risk and progression. To discover novel biomarkers of cancer and identify potential causal pathways, we measured 7,000 aptamers using the SomaScan® 7K Assay in a case-cohort study of ~20,000 participants within the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition (EPIC). This presentation will describe early insights from the study including potential new biomarkers of specific cancers and mortality, as well as highlight common sets of predictive proteins across cancer types.
Location: Spotlight Theater E - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
SearchResultBody: ESP1E. Discovering novel causes and biomarkers of cancer through high dimensional proteomics within a large-scale prospective cohort

Title: Discovering novel causes and biomarkers of cancer through high dimensional proteomics within a large-scale prospective cohort
